page.title: 08The Army Camp
page.content: The Junior Leaders Regiment Royal Corps of Transport has four squadrons three at Colerne which are 90 squadron,57 squadron and 30 squadron and 32 squadron at Driffield. There are 700 Junior Leaders on the camp. Their training involves driving cars, trucks and riding motorbikes. They start off on simulators until they are used to the controls. They are also taught how to maintain the vehicle and its engine. After this basic training the Junior Leaders may progress to other transport work such as Air Despatching, Parachuting, Radio Operating and lots more. The Junior Leaders also do things for the community like sweeping snow and keeping the Church yard tidy.The Junior Leaders also have a band which they play on special occasions.
